name: 李老师不是你老师
content: November 3 (Release), Mianyang, Sichuan. Shop owners in Western Lengdu gathered to demand rent. It is understood that in 2018, the developer colluded with the municipal government to make false propaganda, claiming that the project had government support, high investment, high returns, 20-year lease and management, and the first 5-year rent of more than 170,000 yuan could be returned to offset the purchase price for promotion, and the investment could be recovered in 10 years, luring a large number of middle-aged and elderly people to buy shops in Western Lengdu, Longmen, Mianyang.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 3, Changsha, Hunan. Villagers in Guanshaling protested in the middle of the night and shouted in unison, "Down with corrupt officials, remove village cadres"
November 3, Xianyang, Shaanxi. The Chenguang No. 1 building was left unfinished, and the owners held banners in a march.
November 1, Sichuan. Migrant workers have been owed wages for three years and have not yet received them. Workers held banners in front of the court to demand their wages.
November 3, Hubei. Qianrui Haoting building owed construction workers wages, and workers defended their rights and demanded wages

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
October 25, Beijing. BMW's first 5S store in the world, Xingdebao, closed down, and employees and car owners gathered at the door to demand wages and defend their rights.
October 26, Zhanjiang, Guangdong. Villagers in Xitou Village, Mo Village, Longtou Town, Potou District protested against the village head for allowing the laboratory near the village to discharge sewage into the village.
October 29, Beijing. The owners of a project of China Green Development Luneng protested against frequent water and power outages. There was even a power outage of more than 24 hours in the summer of 2024.
October 29, Zhuhai, Guangdong. Workers of Enjie Photovoltaic Company held banners to demand wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
October 29, Loudi, Hunan. Workers of the photovoltaic power generation project in the mine in Lengshuijiang City demanded their wages.
October 30, Zhengzhou, Henan. Owners of Haojinyuan in Xinmi City protested against the unfinished project.
October 30, Anyang, Henan. Owners of Ginkgo Plaza demanded the handover of their houses.
October 30, Heze, Shandong. Owners of Tianrun Mansion Yuefu protested that they still had no direct water supply and floor heating after years.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: A businessman tells the story of his experience of being "distant sea fishing"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 2, in Jingdezhen, Jiangxi, a 14-year-old boy covered a girl's mouth and nose in an elevator and carried her away. It was reported online that the boy was released after writing a letter of guarantee because he was a minor. On November 4, the local police responded: The boy involved has been punished, and the parents of both parties have not yet reached an agreement.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Recently, a netizen revealed that the Peking University Library owed wages, and the average daily working hours exceeded 12 hours, all year round. It has been 3 months without a penny.
Netizens said: I can't imagine that China is the largest socialist country on earth, and the people are the masters of the country, and this kind of thing would happen.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 3, a blogger posted a video saying: What do you think of when you mention Zhengzhou, Henan?
This triggered "malicious memories" among netizens

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 4, the Chinese Communist Party's revolutionary historical drama "Northwest Years" will be officially broadcast on Tuesday night. This is the first TV series to feature Xi Zhongxun, the father of Chinese Communist Party veteran and President Xi Jinping, as the protagonist. Actor Jin Dong plays Xi Zhongxun, and actress Ni Ni plays Xi Jinping's mother Qi Xin.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 4 (Release) A video of a child holding a dagger and practicing "killing skills" went viral online.
Netizens responded, "If they didn't speak Chinese, I would have thought it was Hamas."
"Only builders practice, successors shouldn't practice this."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On November 3, CCTV released a video to dispel the rumor that "schools require students to sign organ donation commitments" was a fake information posted by netizens to gain traffic.
However, some netizens in the comment area still did not buy it. Netizens replied, "It is a rumor dispelling, now I have to believe it."
"Just look at it the other way around, I have never suffered any loss in all these years relying on this."
"I didn't believe it at first, but now I believe it a little bit."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At present, major official media have begun to delete previous reports promoting Jiang Ping.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 2, Hunan. A woman posted that she accidentally left her phone in the toilet while visiting Beijing Universal Studios on October 30. The phone was later picked up by another woman. She tried to contact the lost phone, but the other party turned off the phone.
The woman said that there were photos of her mother before her death and her mother's last words in the phone. If the other party was willing to return it, she would not pursue the matter.
At present, the other party has not returned the phone and has also thrown away the SIM card.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On November 3, South Korean media reported that in return for deploying troops to Russia, North Korea demanded that Russia provide 600,000 to 700,000 tons of rice each year, provide a monthly salary of $2,000 for soldiers fighting in Ukraine, and obtain "advanced space technology."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, Hong Kong's famous director Johnnie To said in an exclusive interview with the BBC that Hong Kong has lost human rights and freedom. He also said that the authorities' control over Hong Kong is because they have no confidence in the people and the country. Hong Kong's official media Ta Kung Pao quickly issued an article to refute: He said that the fact that he could accept an interview with the BBC and still say that Hong Kong has no freedom just proves that Hong Kong has freedom of speech.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 3, Foshan, Guangdong. The man said he sold a watch on Xianyu, and his bank card was frozen by Shanghai police the next day after he received the money. Shanghai police said the money he received was fraudulent funds. The local police in Foshan said they had no way to deal with it.
The man said that he was exhausted physically and mentally and couldn't sleep well every day. Because he was in a cash flow business, he could only sell assets to recover funds.
At present, the video has been deleted.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: November 3, Dongguan, Guangdong. A traffic police officer and a man in auxiliary police uniform had a physical conflict. During the conflict, the traffic police officer sprayed the man in uniform with pepper spray, and the man in uniform swung a stick to fight back.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
November 3 (Released) Taiwan. A Chinese tourist entered the restaurant of Taipei City Government and ate, spending a total of NT$90.
The man was impressed that he could enter and exit the government building freely, while it was difficult to enter the government building in mainland China. He recalled that when he worked at CCTV, an intern had to spend NT$20 for a meal, while a regular employee only had to spend NT$5.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: This year, in order to fight fascism, a Chinese soldier named "Cricket" who came to Russia to join the army with great enthusiasm complained in a live broadcast that after arriving, he found that we were all cannon fodder, and the Russian government also owed wages. The promised monthly salary of 250,000 yuan was only tens of thousands of rubles, and there was no compensation for killing the enemy or being injured. At present, he is the only Chinese mercenary left in the camp, and a total of 6 Chinese died on the front line in September and October.
